title: Burgers' equation
summary: Burgers' equation or Bateman–Burgers equation is a fundamental partial differential equation and convection–diffusion equation[1] occurring in various areas of applied mathematics, such as fluid mechanics,[2] nonlinear acoustics,[3] gas dynamics, and traffic flow.[4] The equation was first introduced by Harry Bateman in 1915[5][6] and later studied by Johannes Martinus Burgers in 1948.[7]
